qas.question: How have international relations developed due to the recent political changes in Burma ?

answers.text: relations have thawed since the reforms following the 2010 elections.

qas.question: What did the United States do in response to the reform changes of the 2010 Burma elections ?

answers.text: the United States relaxed curbs on foreign aid to Myanmar in November 2011 and announced the resumption of diplomatic relations

qas.question: What type of activity has the European Union engaged in in response to the reforms made in Burma ?

answers.text: sanctions on Myanmar, including an arms embargo, cessation of trade preferences, and suspension of all aid with the exception of humanitarian aid.

qas.question: How did the United States treat Myanmar prior to the changes made in Burmese government ?

answers.text: years of diplomatic isolation and economic and military sanctions

context: Though the country's foreign relations, particularly with Western nations, have been strained, <a0_0>relations have thawed since the reforms following the 2010 elections.<a0_0/> After <a3_0>years of diplomatic isolation and economic and military sanctions<a3_0/>, <a1_0>the United States relaxed curbs on foreign aid to Myanmar in November 2011 and announced the resumption of diplomatic relations<a1_0/> on 13 January 2012 The European Union has placed <a2_0>sanctions on Myanmar, including an arms embargo, cessation of trade preferences, and suspension of all aid with the exception of humanitarian aid.
